ArticleTitle.sentence: cAMP-dependent regulation of proenkephalin by JunD and JunB: positive and negative effects of AP-1 proteins.

event.clue: cAMP-dependent regulation of proenkephalin by JunD and JunB: positive and negative effects of AP-1 proteins.

AbstractText.sentence: We demonstrate that JunD, a component of the AP-1 transcription factor complex, activates transcription of the human proenkephalin gene in a fashion that is completely dependent upon the cAMP-dependent protein kinase, protein kinase A.

event.clue: We demonstrate that JunD, a component of the AP-1 transcription factor complex, activates transcription of the human proenkephalin gene in a fashion that is completely dependent upon the cAMP-dependent protein kinase, protein kinase A.

AbstractText.sentence: Activation of proenkephalin transcription by JunD is dependent upon a previously characterized cAMP-, phorbol ester-, and Ca(2+)-inducible enhancer, and JunD is shown to bind the enhancer as a homodimer.

event.clue: Activation of proenkephalin transcription by JunD is dependent upon a previously characterized cAMP-, phorbol ester-, and Ca(2+)-inducible enhancer, and JunD is shown to bind the enhancer as a homodimer.

AbstractText.sentence: Another component of the AP-1 transcription complex, JunB, is shown to inhibit activation mediated by JunD.

event.clue: Another component of the AP-1 transcription complex, JunB, is shown to inhibit activation mediated by JunD.
Another component of the AP-1 transcription complex, JunB, is shown to inhibit activation mediated by JunD.

AbstractText.sentence: As a homodimer JunB is unable to bind the enhancer; however in the presence of c-Fos, high-affinity binding is observed.

event.clue: As a homodimer JunB is unable to bind the enhancer; however in the presence of c-Fos, high-affinity binding is observed.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, JunD is shown to activate transcription of genes linked to both cAMP and phorbol ester response elements in a protein kinase A-dependent fashion, further blurring the distinction between these response elements.

event.clue: Furthermore, JunD is shown to activate transcription of genes linked to both cAMP and phorbol ester response elements in a protein kinase A-dependent fashion, further blurring the distinction between these response elements.

AbstractText.sentence: These results demonstrate that the transcriptional activity of an AP-1-related protein is regulated by the cAMP-dependent second-messenger pathway and suggest that JunD and other AP-1-related proteins may play an important role in the regulation of gene expression by cAMP-dependent intracellular signaling pathways.

event.clue: These results demonstrate that the transcriptional activity of an AP-1-related protein is regulated by the cAMP-dependent second-messenger pathway and suggest that JunD and other AP-1-related proteins may play an important role in the regulation of gene expression by cAMP-dependent intracellular signaling pathways.
